intro: Tetraria microstachys, commonly known as the small-stalked tetraria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and has small, narrow leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, cylindrical fruits called cypselae. Tetraria microstachys is often found in dry habitats and is adapted to thrive in regions with seasonal rainfall.
